result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew Thomas Schutten Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Matthew Thomas Schutten Jr is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Matthew Thomas Schutten Jr was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Matthew Thomas Schutten Jr was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: EACH COIUNT:  Pay all applicable costs, fees and surcharges and supervision fees as ordered. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.

No contact with victim unless the victim requests contact, and then only after the Court or the agent has approved a modification to No Violent Contact.
No firearms.

Successfully complete Batterers Intervention and continued programming.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
Comply with all Family Court orders.
Pay all supervision fees as determined by DOC.
Participate in alcohol and drug assessment.  Successfully complete recommended treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant Matthew Thomas Schutten in court with attorney George David Kidd.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Defendant Matthew Thomas Schutten in court with attorney John Scott Schiro.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

As to Count 2:
Defendant sentenced to serve 60 days in the House of Correction with credit for 1 day time served, consecutive to any other sentence. Court will allow for Huber. COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 12 months.  Probation is to run concurrent with the probation ordered on Count 4.


As to Count 4:
Defendant sentenced to serve 60 days in the House of Correction with credit for 1 day time served, consecutive to any other sentence. Court will allow for Huber.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 12 months.  Probation is to run concurrent with the probation ordered on Count 2.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 10 days in the House of Correction on Count 1 and 10 day in the House of Correction on Count 2.  This time is stayed pending a review on 12/11/2015.
-Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" and continued programming.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-Maintain absolute sobriety.
-No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the the Court or the agent has approved a modification to no violent contact.
-Comply with all family court orders.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs, fees, and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-No firearms.

Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Case adjourned to Branch 38.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for December 11, 2015 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Matthew Thomas Schutten in court with attorney George David Kidd for John Schiro.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case has resolved.  
Upon motion of the state counts 1 and 3 are dismissed.  States moves to amend the language in count 4 to state "otherwise disorderly conduct" from violent conduct.
As to counts 2 and 4:   Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  
Sentencing is adjourned to 9-8-2015.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 8, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Matthew Thomas Schutten in court with attorney John Scott Schiro.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin 
with Micha Schwab (under the student practice rule).  
Motion of defense counsel to withdraw as counsel is heard and granted by the Court.  Defendant is not eligible for a public defender.  Court ordered case adjourned for Status of Counsel in Branch 38 on 8-6-2015 at 8:15 am.  Defendant will need to prepare and bring a financial statement on the next date, at which time the Court can review his eligibility for the appointment of counsel by the Court.  Parties are advised that EFFECTIVE August 3, 2015, this case will be assigned to JUDGE WAGNER, BRANCH 38, in Room 504 in the Courthouse.   mld
from Attorney John Schiro, received and filed.   mld
to WIthdraw from Attorney John Schiro, for defendant, received and filed.   mld

Defendant Matthew Thomas Schutten in court with attorney George David Kidd.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant's Motion to Sever Charges proceeded.  Additional arguments heard.  Defendant's motion to sever Count 1 and Count 2 from Count 3 and Count 4 is denied.   Same conditions of bail to remain.  Jury trial scheduled for July 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
from Defendant to Sever Charges, received and filed.   mld

Defendant Matthew Thomas Schutten in court with attorney John Scott Schiro.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Pretrial Conference held off the record.  Upon the request of defense counsel, case adjourned for Motion Hearing to Sever the Charges of Counts #1 and #2 from #3 and #4.  Case adjourned for Motion Hearing in Branch 4 on 4-28-2015 at 8:30 am.  Agreed Upon request for a New Court Date, signed and filed.   mld

dated 2-9-2015, addressed to ADA Evan Glaberson, District Attorney's Office, with a Demand for Discovery and Inspection.  CC copy of the letter was forwarded to the court.   Letter, received and filed.   mld

Defendant Matthew Thomas Schutten in court with attorney John Scott Schiro.  Evan Glaberson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Offer needed by defense counsel.  Motion to Sever may be filed, per defense counsel.  Upon the request of defense counsel, who will need to review the discovery and offer with defendant, case adjourned for Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 3-17-2015 at 1:30 am.  The Court added the following party to the no contact order.  All conditions of bail are continued, including no contact with Jacqueline R., or Jessica W., and no violations of the law, until further order of the Court.   mld
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with JR.

Defendant Matthew Thomas Schutten in court with attorney John Scott Schiro.  Lovell Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 4.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 4.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
